data.title: Everything goes better with beer
data.text: Free State beer is the best. They have a lot of varieties and some great seasonal beers that are fantastic too. They have a great menu and their beer battered onion rings are to die for

data.title: This is a great place!
data.text: Great fresh food made by an amazing chef!  Great staff and atmosphere; not to mention their finely crafted beers!  Always a favorite place to eat when I'm in town!

data.title: Because without beer, things don't go as well.
data.text: Or so says Kansas monk Brother Epps. Thanks to the founders of this brewery, brew pubs came back to KS about 20ish years ago. FS still serves some of the same dishes and same beers they did when they opened, and quality has been consistent. I know there are many good things on the menu, but I can't get past the gumbo. Yumbo. Only thing lacking is a beer garden. Try to get a table up front. The back is dark and lacks atmosphere.

data.title: Just ordinary food
data.text: I'd recommend Free State for beer.  Period.   The food and service felt just ordinary, as if it could be in Anytown, USA.  Think heavy bar food.  You'll find much better options in Lawrence.

data.title: It's Bar Food
data.text: People seem to love it.  It does have good atmosphere and seems like a fun place.  The food is typical bar food which is good sometimes, but easily duplicated.

data.title: Very Good
data.text: The Basil Garden beer is awesome but only served during the warmer months.  The food is good and reasonalbe plus there is a large variety of choices.  It's a casual bar atmosphere with cute decor.

data.title: Crowded and for good reason
data.text: Reservations are a must. The place was crowded. I don't usually drink beer. Just not my "cup of tea." But this place brews many kinds of beer, from IPAs to the stout that I liked. They know their beer and will talk about it, the process, the varieties, the romance of each. It is a pleasure listening to a staff invested in what they do. And the food is both excellent and reasonably priced. It would be difficult to enter, listen to the staff, eat and drink, and not leave just feeling good. Worth the trip.

data.title: Great Onion Rings
data.text: We chose this restaurant based on the reviews and had a nice dinner.  The best of our food was the onion rings.  The waiter kindly suggested a half order which was plenty for two people with our other food.  Service was excellent and beer choices interesting.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: I really wanted to enjoy this meal as the restaurant was so well reviewed online. Unfortunately the medium-rare steak I ordered was well done and the mashed potatoes were so salty I couldn't eat them. The entree was gorgeous though and the staff were fabulous. I did get a deduction from my bill for the steak because I chose to eat it rather than wait for a replacement to be cooked - which was offered.

data.title: Usually a Good Choice
data.text: This was not our first visit, we have eaten here at least a dozen times. It is our favorite place to eat in Lawrence, KS. The cheddar ale soup, which is my all-time favorite soup, was delicious as usual. It is the perfect Fall soup. My husband had the chicken pesto pasta. The chicken was tender & well seasoned; but there was something off about the pesto. It was too salty & harsh tasting. This was an anomaly; as every other meal we we have had here has been good. The service was fine, our drinks were constantly replenished. We will come here again; we will just avoid the pesto.

data.title: A Favorite stop in Lawrence
data.text: This is my second time visiting the Free State Brewing Co. I really wanted to come back and I wasn't disappointed. We all found our food excellent, and two of us had the Octoberfest beer, which was good. My husband had the Applewood Smoked Brisket Sandwich and loved it. His brother had the Black Bean Burger, which he says is the best he's ever had. I chose the Gorgonzola mushroom gnocchi, which has a note of sweetness in dried figs, which complements the savory sauce. It was memorable and so delicious; I'm glad I couldn't eat it all so I have leftovers.

data.title: Awesome beer!
data.text: Love the interior decoration, and the staff is great. They ensure that you have the best beer possible, very knowledgeable and helpful with tastings. The food is a separate ordering system but it is absolutely fantastic the Cuban sandwich was very authentic.  The outdoor area is nice when the temperature is good and has a very friendly warm feeling

data.title: Nice local food & grog place downtown-
data.text: Sort of a brewery, sporty type restaurant/pub. Good food & locals joint. Always crowded. Food was pretty fresh & great selection of seasonal beer. Apps pretty tasty too.

data.title: Brisket special + Service
data.text:
Took a day trip to Lawrence last week. We stopped at Free State Brewing Co--we were seated immediately, and our waiter was excellent, very attentive.  I tried the Turkey Focaccia, my husband had the Brisket sandwich special.
Overall, his meal was very good. The brisket had a sweet bbq sauce, and the bun was soft.  The Turkey on Focaccia was just average--definitely edible, but I would not order it twice. The fries were good, but typical.
Atmosphere-wise, we visited during lunch so it was fairly busy but we got right in. The dining area was loud and somewhat cramped, so if you are looking for a quiet meal this might not be the place.

data.title: Never had anything less than excellent
data.text: We always eat at Free State when in Lawrence. Would come here from home if not for the 30 min one way ride. Ate here today with sophomore grand daughter (OSU not KU). Had reubens and tortellini and potatoes salad with the sandwiches. Was a 45 min wait but got in after 16 min even though the place was packed and no I don't know anyone on staff just lucky I guess.  Food arrival took a bit longer than usual but was hot to trot when it got here. And, all of the food was so so so good fresh flavorful.

data.title: History, great food and service
data.text: If you find yourself in Lawrence Kansas, Free State is a must stop.  The history of the place is fascinating, the beer is superb and the food is amazing.  If you look at the menu and don't know what to chose, go for the special, I've never been disappointed.

data.title: Good if you like breweries are you
data.text: It's A local bar and grill that brews their own beer. And you can get jugs to go. And there is a patio out doors facing west so you can get sun in the afternoon. I didn't care for the food and all that much but the atmosphere was great.

data.title: I have eaten here many many times and always good.
data.text: the specials are usually really good  You can't go wrong with the basic burger, black bean quesadilla or steak.

data.title: Great if you can get in
data.text:
Wonderful smiling service and "real" food--not just hamburgers but an exciting daily special to go along with menu favorites. What I especially like is the info cards about the day in history. 
A very busy place on weekends. You may have to wait, but they'll give you a buzzer to carry so you can go see what's playing at Liberty Theatre while you wait.

data.title: Absolutely delicious!!!
data.text: We had a great meal and loved the vibrant atmosphere. Great beers brewed on site. " score board" with current selections . Fabulous food and a very knowledgable waiter. My husband didn't care for the first beer and the waiter immediately said stop drinking and let's try another. I had the golden beet sandwich and my husband had the roasted beet salad. Truly delicious.
